image.altText: A crate of western rock lobsters

props.synopsis: Australian rock lobster exports to China look set to resume by the end of the year, and many are celebrating. Here's what that decision means for industry and consumers alike.

title.children: China has lifted the ban on Australian rock lobster imports – what does it mean for you?

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a white dress shirt sits at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Andre Rebelo allegedly murdered his mother for financial gain after the 28-year-old found himself in debt in the pursuit of portraying a glamorous lifestyle on social media, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Man allegedly murdered mother after becoming mired in debt while chasing glamorous social media image, court told

image.altText: He wears a cap and blue shirt and stands near a shipping container

props.synopsis: Veteran truck driver Kym Mozol's vehicle was bogged for almost a week in outback Western Australia. He is now in a "mad panic" as he races against the clock to get to his daughter's wedding in Adelaide.

title.children: Truck driver racing to daughter's wedding after week-long outback bogging ordeal

image.altText: Long channels of water next to a crop.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's remotest agricultural regions would almost double in size under an ambitious plan announced by the West Australian government.

title.children: Cotton production set to dominate expansion of remote Australian agricultural region

image.altText: Fremantle AFLW player Tunisha Kikoak (centre) smiles and celebrates with two teammates after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: Fremantle went into this year of AFLW without key players Kiara Bowers and Ange Stannett — but a combination of new personnel, a change in game style and better team defence has the Dockers on track for their best return in three seasons.

title.children: How Fremantle has turned a star duo's absence into a chance for growth

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: British YouTube personality and rapper Yung Filly is granted bail by a Perth court after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in his hotel room following a show at a Perth nightclub.

title.children: British rapper Yung Filly bailed after being charged with sexually assaulting woman in Perth hotel room

image.altText: Aerial photos of new cars, mostly white, lined up a Fremantle Port after unloading in November 2023.

props.synopsis: An aerial photograph of new cars at Fremantle Port tells the story of modern car colours — a sea of white, dotted with some grey/silver and black, with only occasional splashes of red or blue.

title.children: Bright colours banished as white wins out in a monochrome new car market

image.altText: A red brick building with a sign which says Moora Bowling Club.

props.synopsis: With populations shifting and community sport participation declining, towns such as Moora are looking into new uses for old clubrooms and other spaces that have seen better days.

title.children: Sign of the times as town turns 'dead space' bowlo into a playground

image.altText: A live sports betting site on a mobile phone, April 24, 2020.

props.synopsis: When the prime minister answered a question about protecting children from gambling harm he gave statistics that mystified experts and advocates. The source of the figures remains a mystery.

title.children: A mystery gambling statistic has entered our debate, and no one knows where it came from

image.altText: People gather in front of a destroyed building in Lebanon.

props.synopsis: Israel has launched a deadly airstrike on central Beirut, while its ground troops in Lebanon have been accused of firing on the UN peacekeeping headquarters.

title.children: Israel strikes central Beirut, killing 22 and injuring 117 as IDF fires on UN peacekeeper positions, UN force says

image.altText: A teen girl sitting in front of a pink wall

props.synopsis: Now 13, Hiba dreams of being able to go to school, like other girls her age. Instead she sits on the side of the road, surrounded by bombed and broken houses, selling handmade bracelets.

title.children: Inside the life of a 13 year-old girl, trying to survive 'a war of hell' in Gaza

image.altText: Trump Harris composite

props.synopsis: Professor Allan Lichtman is the "Nostradamus" of US politics. His system has seen him predict the winner of elections consistently since the 1980s and he believes this one is already in the bag.

title.children: 'It's governing, not campaigning, that counts': Is the race for the White House already over?

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis vial

props.synopsis: The father of a man who took his own life after being prescribed medicinal cannabis says his family was repeatedly sent more cannabis, despite notifying the telehealth platform of his death. The ABC can reveal the founder of the company has been banned from supplying cannabis and two doctors have been suspended.

title.children: Doctors under investigation, founder of medicinal cannabis telehealth company banned from supplying drug after death of patient

image.altText: A shoe on the floor of a kitchen is seen from up close

props.synopsis: Ecovacs robot vacuums in multiple US cities were hacked in the space of a few days, with the attacker physically controlling them and yelling obscenities through their onboard speakers.

title.children: Hackers take control of robot vacuums in multiple cities, yell racial slurs

image.altText: A roof is shredded across a large baseball field with only a small part of the stadium roof in tact

props.synopsis: The storm hit with wind gusts of up to 205 kilometres per hour, with authorities continuing to work throughout the state of Florida to help those in need.

title.children: Hurricane Milton kills at least 10 people in Florida, knocks out power to 3 million homes and businesses

image.altText: Two men walk through a field on a farm with blue sky.

props.synopsis: ACTU president Michele O'Neil is calling on the government to reform a temporary working visa scheme that prevents workers leaving bad bosses and to blacklist dodgy employers who use migration worker exploitation as a business model.

title.children: A temporary working visa scheme slammed as a 'modern day slavery risk' urgently needs overhauling, advocates say

image.altText: Nadal in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Spain's Rafael Nadal, a 22-time grand slam champion, says it was a difficult decision that took him some time, but "in this life, everything has a beginning and an end".

title.children: Rafael Nadal to retire from professional tennis after next month's Davis Cup

image.altText: A middle-aged South Korean woman with long dark hair looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Han was recognsed by the Swedish Academy's Nobel Committee "for her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life".

title.children: South Korean author Han Kang awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature

image.altText: Silhouhette of a woman against a graphic background of red and blue, with a photo of a corridor in the background.

props.synopsis: The workplace safety regulator finds a new centre for women recovering from domestic, sexual and family violence in regional NSW has exposed its workers to "psychological injury", after the departure of most of its frontline staff.

title.children: Staff at Australian-first DV trauma recovery centre raise 'major red flags' over workplace safety

image.altText: A woman sitting on a bench, speaking and gesturing.

props.synopsis: The princess joins her husband in Southport, north-west England, to meet the families of several children killed in a stabbing attack there earlier this year.

title.children: Princess Catherine makes surprise appearance in English town rocked by deadly stabbing attack

image.altText: Exterior of pizza shop with sunset in background

props.synopsis: Frontline services are warning Katherine women are among the "least safe in the country" after the deaths of two women, and the hospitalisation of two others, in the past few months.

title.children: 'Least safe in the country': Frontline services sound alarm over Katherine DV crisis

image.altText: Police have arrested the husband of Frances Crawford over her alleged murder

props.synopsis: Police have charged the husband of Frances Crawford with murder.

title.children: Husband of Queensland psychologist who died in apparent ride-on lawnmower incident charged with murder

image.altText: Regional newspapers thumbnail

props.synopsis: The loss of local newspapers across regional Australia is having a huge impact — from today's history not being recorded to residents missing friends' funerals because there's nowhere to publish death notices.

title.children: Hundreds of news outlets have closed in regional Australia. Some say that's a threat to democracy

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The local share market could lose ground at the open after inflation and jobless claims data slightly eased expectations of a US rate cut. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to follow Wall Street lower on US inflation, jobs data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US inflation a bit too hot, unemployment a bit too bad

image.altText: A middle-aged woman looks defiantly at the camera, while holding the handle of a shovel.

props.synopsis: Fed up with the threat of floods, Victorian resident Tuesday Browell is thought to be the first private Australian resident to import war-zone technology to protect her home.

title.children: Why this woman has fortified her bush home with a bullet-and-blast-proof military barrier

image.altText: Courtney Michelle stands with a phone in her hand outside.

props.synopsis: More Aussies are falling victim to an organised criminal underground selling counterfeit smartphones, designed to look and feel like the real deal.

title.children: The 'underground economy' of counterfeit phones ripping off Australians

image.altText: Photo illustration of autonomous self-driving cars on a highway.

props.synopsis: Time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Hurricane Milton, Laneway lineups, and is your car watching you?

image.altText: Craig Goodwin points to the sky

props.synopsis: The Socceroos have come from behind to beat China 3-1 at Adelaide Oval, handing Tony Popovic victory in his first match as coach.

title.children: Craig Goodwin's screamer gives Socceroos victory over China

image.altText: Two women stand outside close together smiling widely, with colourful cement and iron structure behind them.

props.synopsis: While stigma about couples with big age gaps still exists, it's shifting thanks to young people's dissatisfaction with the relationship models they've inherited. And for these happy couples, different ages have proven to be a non-issue.

title.children: A two-decade age gap hasn't got in the way of this couple's happiness, but stigma has threatened to

image.altText: Bernard Fanning and Paul Dempsey pose wearing matching business suits.

props.synopsis: When Bernard Fanning and Paul Dempsey joined forces, repeating themselves was out. Subverting the expectations of Powderfinger and Something For Kate fans was in.

title.children: These frontmen wanted to create music 'Something For Kate and Powderfinger would run an absolute mile from'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing at dispatch box in Parliament.

props.synopsis: Under pressure and reverting to his worst instincts, Anthony Albanese used Tourette syndrome as an insult in parliament. You just had to look at two of his ministers' faces to see how far he'd fouled.

title.children: Eyes darting, mouths open: You just had to look at his ministers' faces to see how far Albanese had fouled

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks downwards.

props.synopsis: A senior staffer to Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles has alleged she was forced out of her job after raising an internal bullying complaint.

title.children: Deputy PM's top staffer says she was forced out of her job after raising a bullying complaint

image.altText: A drone and machine parts scattered in a room.

props.synopsis: To fill an urgent labour shortage in wartime Russia, the Kremlin has been recruiting women aged 18-22 from places like Uganda, Rwanda, Kenya, South Sudan, Sierra Leone and Nigeria, as well as the South Asian country of Sri Lanka.

title.children: Africans recruited to work in Russia say they were duped into building drones for use in Ukraine

image.altText: Young girl leaning against window

props.synopsis: Essays aren't for everybody, and some students and teachers would like to see more flexible and creative approaches to learning to support those who are neurodivergent.

title.children: Neurodivergent students say 'more creativity in the curriculum' would transform their learning

image.altText: Kyah Simon of Sydney FC posing for the camera, holding a soccer ball in one hand

props.synopsis: A new course to help community coaches, umpires, participants and volunteers deal with incidents of racism in the moment is hoped to improve local sport.

title.children: 'You're fighting on your own': Focus on combating racism in community sport
